country_overview.content: Canada, known for its stunning natural landscapes, multicultural cities, and friendly locals, is a top destination for tourists, students, and professionals. From the majestic Rocky Mountains to vibrant cities like Toronto and Vancouver, Canada offers a diverse range of experiences. The Canadian visa system, managed by Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC), facilitates various types of visas for different purposes, including tourism, work, and study. Visa applications are processed through Canadian embassies and consulates worldwide.

tourist_visa.title: Tourist Visa (Temporary Resident Visa - TRV)
tourist_visa.description: The Tourist Visa (TRV) allows visitors to stay in Canada for up to 6 months for tourism, visiting family or friends, or attending events.

student_visa.title: Student Visa (Study Permit)
student_visa.description: The Student Visa (Study Permit) is for individuals accepted into a Canadian educational institution. It allows for full-time study and is valid for the duration of the course plus a possible extension.

work_visa.title: Work Visa (Work Permit)
work_visa.description: The Work Visa (Work Permit) is for foreign nationals seeking employment in Canada. It allows individuals to work for a specific employer and is generally valid for up to 2 years, with the possibility of extension.

business_visa.title: Business Visa (Temporary Resident Visa for Business)
business_visa.description: The Business Visa allows individuals to travel to Canada for short-term business activities such as meetings and conferences.

tourist_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must demonstrate that they are visiting Canada for tourism, have a valid passport, sufficient funds, and intend to return to their home country. An interview may be required.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
additional_documents: Letter of invitation from a friend or family member (if applicable)
Proof of employment or studies in the home country

student_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must be accepted into a Canadian educational institution and demonstrate their ability to financially support themselves. An interview may be required.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Letter of acceptance from a Canadian educational institution

work_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have a job offer from a Canadian employer and meet specific qualifications. An interview may be required.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Job offer letter or employment contract
Proof of relevant qualifications and experience
additional_documents: Proof of any previous visits to Canada

step_1.title: Determine Visa Type
step_1.description: Identify the appropriate visa type based on your purpose of visit to Canada. Ensure you meet the eligibility requirements for the selected visa category.

step_2.title: Check Eligibility
step_2.description: Review the specific eligibility requirements for the visa type you are applying for, including health and character requirements.

step_3.title: Gather Required Documents
step_3.description: Collect all necessary documents including the visa application form, passport, photographs, and supporting documents relevant to your visa type.

step_4.title: Complete the Application Form
step_4.description: Fill out the visa application form accurately. Applications can be submitted online or through Canadian embassies and consulates.

step_5.title: Submit the Application
step_5.description: Submit your completed application form along with the required documents. Ensure that all documents are provided as per the requirements for your visa type.

step_6.title: Wait for Processing
step_6.description: Processing times for Canadian visas vary based on the type of visa and individual circumstances. Check current processing times on the IRCC website.

step_7.title: Receive the Visa
step_7.description: Once your visa is approved, you will be notified. Ensure that all details on the visa are correct before traveling.

visa_fees.content: Visa fees for Canadian visas vary depending on the type of visa and duration of stay. Fees are payable at the time of application and are non-refundable.

processing_time.content: Processing times for Canadian visas vary. Tourist and business visas typically take a few weeks, while student and work visas may take longer. Check current processing times on the IRCC website.

visa_validity.content: The validity of Canadian visas depends on the type of visa issued. Tourist visas are generally valid for up to 6 months, while work and student visas may be valid for the duration of employment or study plus a possible extension.

entry_requirements.content: Upon arrival in Canada, travelers must present their valid visa, passport, and may be required to provide additional documentation such as proof of accommodation and sufficient funds.

faq_1.question: Can I extend my visa while in Canada?
faq_1.answer: Visa extensions may be possible depending on the type of visa. You should contact Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) for detailed information on the extension process.

faq_2.question: Is a visa required before arrival in Canada?
faq_2.answer: Yes, most travelers need to obtain a visa before arriving in Canada. You can apply for a visa online or through a Canadian embassy or consulate.

faq_3.question: Can I work in Canada on a Tourist Visa?
faq_3.answer: No, working on a Tourist Visa is not allowed. If you wish to work in Canada, you must apply for a Work Visa.
